numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The survey gathered results by telephone.
2. I wonder whether the results are skewed.
3. A telephone survey forces a voluntary response.
4. A person shares an opinion only if the person answers the phone.
5. Some people are willing to answer the phone.
6. Some people are not willing to respond.
7. I wonder whether people who answer the phone have a different opinion than people who do not respond.
8. I noticed a pattern in the responses of the younger generation.
9. A majority of the responses of the younger generation fall between 25% and 75%.
10. This pattern may indicate that people collectively think that the world is becoming a better place.
11. This pattern also shows a range of responses.
12. This range raises questions about factors.
13. Some factors may influence the opinion in a certain country at a specific time.
14. The U.S. is higher on the graph than I expect.
15. I often hear people of my age say that they wish that they lived in the era of their parents or grandparents.
16. The title is: The Ages of Optimism.
